00025 // Definitions helpful for representing a bitmap as an array of integers
00026 #define BITS_IN_BYTE    8
00027 #define BITS_IN_WORD    32
00028 
00039 class BitMap {
00040   public:
00041     BitMap(int nitems);         // Initialize a bitmap, with "nitems" bits
00042                                 // initially, all bits are cleared.
00043     ~BitMap();                  // De-allocate bitmap
00044     
00045     void Mark(int which);       // Set the "nth" bit
00046     void Clear(int which);      // Clear the "nth" bit
00047     bool Test(int which);       // Is the "nth" bit set?
00048     int Find();                 // Return the # of a clear bit, and as a side
00049                                 // effect, set the bit. 
00050                                 // If no bits are clear, return -1.
00051     int NumClear();             // Return the number of clear bits
00052 
00053     void Print();               // Print contents of bitmap
00054     
00055     // These aren't needed until filesystem, when we will need to read and 
00056     // write the bitmap to a file
00057     void FetchFrom(OpenFile *file);     // fetch contents from disk 
00058     void WriteBack(OpenFile *file);     // write contents to disk
00059 
00060   private:
00061     int numBits;                        
00062     int numWords;                       
00067     unsigned int *map;                  
00068 };
